review_title: The small isn't really a lofty or comfortable thing. Usually people get hoodies for that reason
reviews:
Hey guys, just doing my share of reviews for those comparing this to hanes or just wants to just know in general how this sweater is.

I got a small, black hoodie.

Stats: Male, 5'7", 145lbs, athletic build, slim frame

The sweater fit really well around the torso and arms. The sleeves were a bit shorter by hoodie standards, they fell on my hands as a tailored dress shirt would, which leads me to my next point. The small isn't really a lofty or comfortable thing. Usually people get hoodies for that reason. I personally ordered two hoodies: A medium ash grey (for lofting) and a small black.

The length of the sweater hits my waist just below the belt line. So i think those that are taller than me may find that that this sweater is too short. Maybe if you're 5'8" with shorter than average arms this would work. But I think if you're 5'9" a medium would definitely be best for you.

Because baggy black hoodies doesn't really look classy (not like you'd wear one at a formal event tbh), I just like the look of a black hoodie to wear with good light pair of jeans and runners, yet I still don't want to look like I rolled out of bed. This modern fit on an old classic look is achieves my goal.

The neckhole could be bigger, but it's not a big problem. Some reviewers on the hanes hoodie said it was problematic, so that's the reason I got gildan.

review_title: Comparison to Hanes Men's Ultimate Pullover Heavyweight Fleece Hoodie
reviews:
Ordered both of these hoodies in a size L as a 5'11, 180lb male.

Comments about this Gildan hoodie:
- I really like this fit (pre-wash)
- Hanes is a baggier fit, length is about the same on both hoodies
- not a heavy hoodie, but not thin either. Inner lining is comfortable and doesn't seem to pill off onto other clothing
- the holes that the drawstring comes out of by the hood are not backed by any plastic or metal, just holes in the fabric
- I haven't washed either hoodie yet (3-5 wears each)

What I like more about the Gildan:
- fits me better (not as baggy as Hanes)
- elastic cuffs at the end of arm sleeves and at the waist are tighter than the Hanes, helps with fit (big difference maker for me - just seems more quality for a $15 hoodie)
- stitching and construction around the sleeves and hood seems *slightly* better than the Hanes, may hold up better in the long run?
- great cheap hoodie option at $15 CAD (be realistic with your expectations when you order a <$20 clothing item from Gildan/Hanes

What I like more about the Hanes:
- drawstring eyelets are reinforced by plastic (coated silver) rings so if you knot your hoodie string they won't slip inside the hood
- inner pilling is MAD comfortable (Gildan is comfy, but not this Huggables-type of soft, but this Hanes material will pill more onto your layer underneath)
